description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dnddo","text":"This protocol describes maintenance of established hPSC lines in expansion media on matrix coated culture vessels.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"aarf4","text":"The reported protocols are based on the authors experience, and may partially differ from the original protocols provided by the companies. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"5s8r5","text":"Depending on the growth characteristics of specific hPSC line, cells must be passaged every 5-7 days in\norder to maintain log phase of growth and avoid induction of differentiation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1afbe","text":"In general hPSC lines are maintained in a 6 well format, however information on other tissue culture vessel formats are also included in this protocol as a guidance. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"93p40","text":"LABORATORY EQUIPMENT AND CONSUMABLES","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fbvk","text":"Use sterile material","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5jh4","text":"1/5/10 mL serological pipettes ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hlft","text":"15/50 mL conical tubes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2r40","text":"Cell culture treated plastic vessels of choice e.g. 24, 12 or 6-well plates, T25, T75 flasks, 10cm dishes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9gj10","text":"10/200/1000µL tips and micropipettes (optional)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"abrud","text":"Aspirator pump with disposable pipette","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"538qq","text":"Centrifuge","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c09fa","text":"Microscope, if available Stereo Microscope","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55ihr","text":"Disposable scraping tools (pipette tips, glass rods, small size cell scrapper, syringe and needle)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bb0lo","text":"Incubator at 37oC and 5% CO2  or under hypoxic conditions,  5% O2/ 5% CO2","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":15,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":27,"length":3},{"style":"sub","offset":64,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":72,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"em2ck","text":"Class related_materials.name: Geltrex™ LDEV-Free, hESC-Qualified, Reduced Growth Factor Basement Membrane Matrix
StemMACS™ iPS-Brew XF human: Basal medium and supplement

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"emd58","text":"Inspect hPSC cultures daily using a microsope to monitor morphology, the presence of spontaneous differentiated cells, and confluence. Based on these observations, determine if the cultures require further action (e.g. removal of differentiated cells, passaging). Use reference images in the protocol: Reference pictures of hiPSC cultured in defined conditions to guide your assessment of the cultures. Cell lines may vary in their growth rate and morphology in different media/matrix combinations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":302,"length":58}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F5D13E51B608472EB9FEE48FC6CD57F3","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/reference-pictures-of-hipsc-cultured-in-defined-co-c5c5y2y6"}}}}

cases.title: Culture >70% confluent
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"66pnl","text":"Culture is >70% confluent and < 10% of the colonies in the culture appear differentiated upon visual inspection. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: Culture with differentiation
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ap2l5","text":"For cultures in which 10–20% of colonies exhibit spontenous differentiated regions upon visual inspection, proceed with removal of the affected areas.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7f1ih","text":"\nIt is advisable to control spontaneous differentiation early after passaging, rather than waiting until cultures reach over 70% confluency.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6pgh9","text":"\nWhenever feasible, avoid combining differentiation removal with passaging, as this may increase cellular stress.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: Culture <70% confluent
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7th2i","text":"Culture requires only media change when it presents < 70% confluency and < 10% spontaneous differentiation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e5poa","text":"If the cells require passaging, refer to the protocol Non-enzymatic passaging of hPSC or Single cell passaging of hPSC. Otherwise performe a complete media change (refer to Culture \u003c70% confluent tab).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":54,"length":31},{"key":1,"offset":89,"length":29}],"data":{}},{"key":"3sfuv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f1hi8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ea27h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"9B33759DA96B4C1EA496ECACF48CD91C","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/non-enzymatic-passaging-of-hpsc-c5auy2ew"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AAD4D0B20DB14A6F8C7065A7F6E6C01F","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/single-cell-passaging-of-hpsc-c5cwy2xe"}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9c4fc","text":"Assessing confluency is inherently subjective. Whenever possible, use imaging systems capable of calculating the surface area of the culture vessel occupied by cells to ensure a consistent and objective evaluation of cell culture confluency.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6iblj","text":"\nIf such imaging tools are not available, utilize a collection of images captured during the culture process at various stages of confluency to train staff in recognizing and estimating different confluency percentages.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"aib1c","text":"\nKeep in mind that the growth rate required to achieve confluency is influenced by both the specific cell line and the cell culture system used.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5p4ah","text":"Use a stereo microscope in a biological safety cabinet to visually identify regions of differentiation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d2r3c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fgcnd","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dui54","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"boat7","text":"Standard inverted microscopes can also be used for examination of colonies. Steromicroscopes offer the advantage of inspecting large areas of the culture at the same time (low magnification). If working with inverted microscope make sure to scan through the most of the well. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e2agj","text":"Remove differentiated regions by scraping the cells with a scraping tool.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ae4ig","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6ukqh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":45,"offset":459}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"achm8","text":"No more than 20% of the colonies should contain differentiated cells in the cultures of high quality. Dispose of the cultures in which differentiated cells are present in more than 20% of the colonies. In extreme cases when the culture is highly valuable, i.e. patient derived iPSCs or there are no back-up cultures, undifferentiated colonies can be positively selected, transfered with pipette to a newculture dish and expanded. For this, refer to protocol: Manual selection and picking of hPSC colonies.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"6B01892ADC124E0FA0A1BDE3ABCE6FEC","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/manual-selection-and-picking-of-hpsc-colonies-d6hx9b7n"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"link"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dqfn4","text":"Tap the side of the plate to resuspend losen cell aggregates and remove the medium from the wells using an aspirator pipette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bb11j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f27fr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"364kl","text":"Do not leave the cells without media for prolonged period of time when changing more than one well. Aspirate maximum 3 wells at a time (i.e. in a 6-well plate) and add fresh media before proceding to further wells. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"645hm","text":"Add fresh medium by gently adding it to the side of the well or flask using a 5 ml or 10 ml pipette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Recommended volumes of maintenance media per tissue culture vessel are shown in the table {"blocks":[{"key":"cm8pq","text":"Prepare required amount of media for washing and for further culture, see Materials and Table 2. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":88,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cm8pq","text":"Pre-warm the medium in a water bath for   or equilibrate the medium to room temperature (   ± Temperature  2 °C ) by placing outside the fridge for   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":19,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":40,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":90,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":149,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4n46k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9s7o6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ep56","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"22","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"up to 1h","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5sq22","text":"Prepare required amount of media for further culture, see Materials and Table 3. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":72,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6j7ad","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cgut9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"83p7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6lsea","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":16,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"466c2","text":"FEEDING SCHEDULE  ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a47c8","text":"It is recommended medium change every 24h for optimal growth. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4t94r","text":"Accordingly to medium composition regular schedules including double feeding (adding twice the required volume of medium) for 48-72h are possible. For example, perform a double feed on a Saturday, with the next medium change on Monday. However, it is not recommended to perform double feeding more than once a week.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4a9ed","text":"Feeding schedule depends on hPSC line proliferation characteristics and intrinsic properties. Therefore, we recommend to test optimal schedule per hPSC line.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dqfn4","text":"Aspirate and discard the medium from the wells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8094","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7s4d6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"46q0","text":"Do not leave the cells without media for prolonged period of time when changing more than one well. Aspirate maximum 3 wells at a time and add fresh media before proceeding to further wells. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"645hm","text":"Add gently fresh medium through the side of the well or flask using a 5 mL or 10 mL pipette. Refer to Table 3 for recommended volumes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":102,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dm2h1","text":"Wash gently once with media. Refer to Table 2 for recommended volumes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":38,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"droj1","text":"The following points should be considered when choosing hPSC culture conditions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5038h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9o0mt","text":"A number of media will work with an array of  different matrices. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b7crg","text":"The rate of growth of cell lines will differ between different matrix/media combinations and cell lines may exhibit a  transient change in morphology until adapted to the new culture conditions. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e49bd","text":"When transitioning cell lines between different media/matrix combinations  follow the manufacturers guidance. Usual recommendations: do not switch the media and matrix at the same time. Make a gradual change of media including proportions until full transition.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hqg5","text":"hPSC often require a couple of passages to adapt to the new culture conditions. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mpdv","text":"Following transition to new culture conditions, perform quality control testing as appropriate for the intended use of the cells.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1gcvg","text":"For commercial media, prepare, store and use as directed by the manufacturer. For  media made in house, use and store under the same conditions established for the validation of the media.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmnm1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3j13g","text":"
